intro: Tarenna dasyphylla, commonly known as the hairy-leafed tarenna, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its opposite, hairy leaves and clusters of small, white flowers. It produces small, round berries that are typically yellow or orange when ripe. Tarenna dasyphylla is often found in moist, shaded areas within tropical forests.
